intro: Inversodicraea abbayesii, commonly known as the Abyssinian sandthorn, is a shrub native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and thorny stems. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with small leaves that reduce water loss. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
